lineages.description: Descendants of survivors whose bloodlines remained untainted by the Runic Blight. Their ancestors survived through luck, preparation, or isolation rather than mutation. Clan-Born represent baseline humanity in Aethelgard, often serving as community leaders and diplomats due to their balanced nature and social adaptability.
lineages.selectionText: The Stable Code – Humanity's baseline. Flexible and adaptable.
lineages.appearanceNotes: No distinctive physical mutations. Typically exhibit the full range of human appearances, though often carry subtle marks of their clan's regional heritage.
lineages.socialRole: Trusted as community leaders and diplomats. Clan-Born often serve as mediators between the other lineages due to their unmodified nature and social adaptability.

uniqueTrait.description: Gain +1d10 to Rhetoric checks when interacting with Clan-Born NPCs.

lineages.description: Those whose ancestors were exposed to concentrated Aether during the Runic Blight. The All-Rune's echo flows through their blood, granting enhanced magical aptitude at the cost of physical resilience. They carry a permanent taint of Corruption that can never be fully cleansed.
lineages.selectionText: The Tainted Aether – Enhanced magical aptitude with inherent Corruption.
lineages.appearanceNotes: Often have faint glowing marks on skin that intensify during Aether use. Eyes may have an unusual luminescence. Some exhibit subtle runic patterns that appear when emotional.
lineages.socialRole: Sought after as scholars, mystics, and Galdr practitioners. Viewed with a mixture of reverence and suspicion by the common folk due to their inherent connection to the corrupted Aether.

uniqueTrait.description: Your Maximum Aether Pool is increased by 10%.

lineages.description: Bloodlines hardened by generations of proximity to Blight-metal in the corrupted mines and forges. Their bodies have developed remarkable resilience to physical harm and environmental hazards, but their minds are more vulnerable to psychic assault and manipulation.
lineages.selectionText: The Corrupted Earth – Physical resilience with mental vulnerability.
lineages.appearanceNotes: Often have a slightly metallic sheen to skin or hair. Some exhibit unusual coloration in veins near the surface. Many have denser bone structure visible in facial features.
lineages.socialRole: Valued as laborers, soldiers, and craftsmen. Their resistance to environmental hazards makes them essential for dangerous work. Often underestimated intellectually due to their physical nature.

uniqueTrait.description: Gain +1d10 to Sturdiness Resolve checks versus environmental hazards.

lineages.description: Those who trace their lineage to the Varangian shamans who communed with primal wolf-spirits before the Great Silence. They carry the blessing of the Wild, granting enhanced physical prowess and instincts. Their Primal Clarity helps resist psychic assault despite their reduced willpower.
lineages.selectionText: The Uncorrupted Echo – Primal connection with balanced physical bonuses.
lineages.appearanceNotes: Often have pronounced canine features, unusual eye colors (amber, silver), or coarser hair. Many have enhanced hearing visible in ear structure. Some exhibit animal-like mannerisms.
lineages.socialRole: Respected as hunters, scouts, and wilderness guides. Their primal instincts make them valuable in dangerous territories. Sometimes viewed as uncivilized by urban populations.

uniqueTrait.description: Take 10% less Psychic Stress from all sources.
